Name: Torso of an Unknown Queen
Description: The torso of this statue is of an unknown queen standing with her left hand crossed on her chest, while the right one is held by her side. The queen is wearing an elaborate dress decorated with long parallel feathers and a belt around her waist. The lower part has two ends tied together with straps. She originally wore the vulture headdress of queens, and the lower parts of the vultures' wings are still visible on each side of the complex headdress. The eyes and the eyebrows were inlaid. On the back pillar, vertical hieroglyphic inscriptions give the queen's name and her royal epithet 'Mistress of the Two Lands, the Great King's Wife.'
